In biology, immunity refers to the body's ability to defend itself against substances that threaten its proper functioning or survival. These "threats" can be of 3 types: microbes (viruses, bacteria, fungi, parasites), cells that have become cancerous or a foreign body (a splinter, as well as a transplanted organ). At certain stages of life and also in winter, the immune system can be weakened.
